Can't receive it why? Is you mail provider marking it as spam and putting it in a spam folder on their mail server? Is the washington post even sending it?

You appear to think someone that is not you can effect change in your installation. That is not true. Thunderbird is software on your computer, installed and manged by you.

content:
The only think I can think of that you could be talking about is message threading and the Washington post do the poorly conceived thing of inappropriately using message references and the new post article threads with the old, but even then, I would expect it to be listed towards the top as it has current mail in the thread.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird#w_changing-default-threading-mode

What do you mean that Tbird is "managed" by me?

As the software is installed on your computer, any changes must be made by you. No one in this forum can change anything on your computer for you. There was a default change to threading about 6 months ago which is why I am guessing you might be talking about that, but I am no wiser now as to what your are trying to describe when I first read your initial question.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: The problem is that it doesn't download all the messages. For example, a client sent me a message at 10 a.m. and I didn't have it until after 1 p.m., where other messages from that 10 a.m. and later normally showed me a message. And it's not a matter of one message, once it showed me a message after 3 days.
creator: klaudiademko7

content: The inboxes are redirected, not the accounts. So despite the email account appearing as if it is redirected, it is not. I perfect example of this is the local folders account has no get messages on the context menu, but in my case it receives mail for probably half a dozen mail accounts.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Alright, thanks! Hopefully it's something the devs will consider for the future, I doubt I'm alone in wanting separate notification rules for my work mail and personal mail!
